title: Marco Marozzi
text:
Marco Marozzi (born 7 January 1999) is an Italian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Fiorentina.
He is a product of <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina%20Youth%20Sector">Fiorentina youth teams</a> and was first included on their Under-19 squad for the 2016–17 season.
Loan to Fermana.
On 12 July 2018, Marozzi joined <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a> club <a href="Fermana%20F.C.">Fermana</a> on a season-long loan. Three months later, on 17 October, he made his professional debut in Serie C for Fermana as a 62nd-minute substitute replacing <a href="Gabriele%20Zerbo">Gabriele Zerbo</a> in a 2–0 home win over <a href="A.S.%20Gubbio%201910">Gubbio</a>. On 3 April 2019, Marozzi played his first match as a starter for the club, a 2–0 away defeat against <a href="Alma%20Juventus%20Fano%201906">Alma Juventus Fano</a>, he was replaced by Gabriele Zerbo in the 59th minute. Marozzi ended his season-long loan to Fermana with only 12 appearances, including 11 of them as a substitute, but he didn't play any entire matches during the loan, he also helped the club to reach the play-off but Fermana loss 2–0 against <a href="A.C.%20Monza">Monza</a> in the first round, he remained an unused substitute.
Loan to Virtus Francavilla.
On 20 August 2019, Marozzi was loaned to <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a> club <a href="Virtus%20Francavilla%20Calcio">Virtus Francavilla</a> on a season-long loan deal. On 15 September he made his debut for the club as a substitute replacing <a href="Francesco%20Puntoriere">Francesco Puntoriere</a> for the last 21 minutes of a 2–2 away draw against <a href="Paganese%20Calcio%201926">Paganese</a>. Three months later, on 15 December, he scored his first professional goal, as a substitute, in the 92nd minute of a 2–1 away defeat against <a href="A.S.%20Viterbese%20Castrense">Viterbese Castrense</a>. On 22 January 2020, Marozzi played his first match as a starter for the club, a 2–1 away win over <a href="Reggina%201914">Reggina</a>, he was replaced by <a href="Federico%20V%C3%A1zquez">Federico Vàzquez</a> after 61 minutes. Marozzi helped the club to reach the play-offs, however Francavilla loss 3–2 against <a href="Calcio%20Catania">Catania</a> in the first round. Marozzi ended his season-long loan to Virtus Francavilla with 17 appearances, 1 goal and 2 assists.
Loan to Ravenna.
On 6 September 2020, Marozzi was signed by <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a> side <a href="Ravenna%20F.C.">Ravenna</a> on a season-long loan deal. On 27 September he made his debut for the club as a substitute replacing <a href="Daniele%20Ferretti">Daniele Ferretti</a> in the 75th minute of a 2–1 home defeat against <a href="F.C.%20S%C3%BCdtirol">Südtirol</a>. On 8 October he scored his first goal for the club, as a substitute, in the 89th minute of a 2–1 home win over <a href="Vis%20Pesaro%20dal%201898">Vis Pesaro</a>. Two weeks later, on 21 October, Marozzi played his first match as a starter for Ravenna, a 2–0 home win over <a href="Virtus%20Verona">Virtus Verona</a>, he was replaced in the 52nd minute by <a href="Marco%20Fiorani">Marco Fiorani</a>. On 24 March 2021, Marozzi played his first entire match for the club, a 0–0 away draw against <a href="A.S.%20Sambenedettese">Sambenedettese</a>. Marozzi ended his loan to Ravenna with 34 appearances, 1 goal and 1 assist, he also played the play-out, however Ravenna loss 4–0 on aggregate against <a href="F.C.%20Legnago%20Salus">Legnago</a> and was relegated in <a href="Serie%20D">Serie D</a>.
